title: The Walkie-Talkie Building: The Skyscraper That Melted Cars
description: A quick, practical guide to The Walkie-Talkie Building: The Skyscraper That Melted Cars.

hook.text: In 2013, a London skyscraper's curved glass facade focused sunlight like a magnifying glass and melted parked cars.

buildup.text: 20 Fenchurch Street's concave south face reflected and concentrated sunlight into a 'death ray' on the street below.

climax.text: A permanent sunshade was installed. The 'Walkie Scorchie' proved that ignoring physics has consequences.

punchline.text: A skyscraper accidentally weaponized sunlight. Twice. By the same architect.

quiz.question: How did the Walkie-Talkie building melt cars?
